image.altText: Election called blog thumbnail

props.synopsis: The PM starts out in Canberra today, while the opposition leader kicks things off from his home city of Brisbane. Follow live.

title.children: Dutton quizzed on referendums for dual citizens, Indigenous recognition

image.altText: A supermarket aisle with shelves of rice being advertised as half-price.

props.synopsis: The details of a price gouging ban would only be decided after an election, but there are precedents to draw on.

title.children: What we know about Labor's plan to ban supermarket price gouging

image.altText: anthony albanese holds a baby and smiles for a photo

props.synopsis: Modelling shows Labor ahead in 10 seats where it was behind six weeks ago, putting it in a stronger position to form government.

title.children: Labor pulls ahead in poll that had Dutton in front six weeks ago

image.altText: A young adult man wearing a broad brimmed hat looking over the ocean

props.synopsis: Young men across the world have been embracing right-wing politics, while young women have moved to the left. Will it happen in the Australian election too?

title.children: Young men are flocking to right-wing politicians overseas. In Australia there's 'a twist'

image.altText: A man in a light denim jacket stands near media at the construction site

props.synopsis: As Pornsak Seingsing ran for his life out of a collapsing high-rise building in Bangkok, he could hear terrified cries at his back.

title.children: As a building collapsed in Bangkok, this worker ran for his life: 'I was the last one'

image.altText: A couple on a scooter rides past a collapsed shrine

props.synopsis: Myanmar's shadow National Unity Government, which coordinates the popular struggle against the ruling military, announces a unilateral partial ceasefire to facilitate earthquake relief efforts.

title.children: 'Nothing short of incredible': Air strikes continue after earthquake in Myanmar

image.altText: A market stall is set up in front of a badly damaged building in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The Hamas militant group says it has accepted a new Gaza ceasefire proposal from mediators Egypt and Qatar, but Israel says it has made a counter-proposal in "full coordination" with the third mediator, the United States.

title.children: Hamas accepts Gaza ceasefire proposal, but Israel makes counteroffer

image.altText: compositie of a man and ocean wind turbines

props.synopsis: An anti-wind farm activist group has been accused of "Trumpian-style" attacks on experts and spreading misinformation and conspiracy theories in marginal Labor seats ahead of the May 3 election.

title.children: 'Won't back down': Inside the anti-wind farm crusade threatening Labor seats

image.altText: Anthony Albanese on Insiders

props.synopsis: In his first major interview of the campaign, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he would be willing to direct gas companies to secure more supplies for Australia if needed, but has downplayed the need for dedicated gas reservation laws as proposed by the Coalition.

title.children: Albanese willing to direct gas exporters to supply Australia 'if needed'

image.altText: Prince Harry talking to young people while in Botswana

props.synopsis: Sources close to the former Sentebale trustees and patrons, including Harry, say they "fully expected this publicity stunt".

title.children: Prince Harry accused of 'bullying at scale' by chair of charity he co-founded

image.altText: Daly Cherry-Evans points with his left hand

props.synopsis: Manly Sea Eagles captain Daly Cherry-Evans will lead his side onto the field at home, just days after publicly announcing he wants to leave the club at the end of the season. Follow live.

title.children: Eyes on Cherry-Evans after captain tells club he wants to leave

image.altText: Colby McKercher and Lachie Sholl compete for a bouncing ball

props.synopsis: The Crows look to maintain their unbeaten start to 2025 as they host the Kangaroos, before West Coast and Fremantle complete round three. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Crows seek top two spot as they host the Kangaroos in Adelaide

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We are underway at Adelaide Oval!

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: A 'lost decade' of low wage growth broke the social compact for young Australians when it comes to housing.

title.children: 'Lost decade' of low wage growth stopped young Australians buying homes

image.altText: JD and Usha Vance stand in the snow with military personnel.

props.synopsis: Leaders in Denmark hit back at US Vice-President JD Vance after his trip to the Pituffik Space Base in north-western Greenland.

title.children: Denmark says it didn't like Vance's 'tone' in Greenland

image.altText: The exterior of a Coles shopfront

props.synopsis: More than 20 pre-packaged salad products are being recalled by two major supermarket retailers after Queensland's public health surveillance detected two products contaminated with a strain of E. coli.

title.children: Major supermarkets recall salad products due to contamination concerns

image.altText: sketch of a woman with red hair holding binoculars to her face with silhouettes of birds in the lens

props.synopsis: Since 1959 the avian flu virus H5N1 has been popping up around the globe. Now scientists believe it could spark the next pandemic.

title.children: This flu virus is spreading and scientists say it has pandemic potential

image.altText: Jess Morrison and Annabelle McIntyre of Australia rowing in the women's pairs

props.synopsis: A former Olympic rowing medallist says a central Queensland venue selected for the 2032 Brisbane Olympics will fail to meet international standards. But data from the Queensland government's Water Monitoring System suggests otherwise.

title.children: Rowers demand 'fair' Olympics as river debate rages ahead of 2032 Games

image.altText: Wide shot of a flooded paddock, a person in the distance walks knee deep along a  barbed wire fenceline

props.synopsis: Western Queensland graziers say they're in for a long recovery as they begin to assess livestock losses from record-breaking floods.

title.children: Graziers brace for 'heartbreaking' devastation from record flood

image.altText: A politician wearing a suit and tie, speaking into microphones.

props.synopsis: Experts have suggested that rape, aggravated attempted robbery, attempted murder, arson and torture charges should be added to Queensland's "adult crime, adult time" laws.

title.children: Queensland's 'adult crime, adult time' laws will be broadened

image.altText: Three police officers stand near small blue cones along the road, examining the area and gesturing at the road.

props.synopsis: Two teenagers who were hit by an allegedly stolen car outside St Edmund's College on Friday morning are now in a stable condition after undergoing emergency surgery.

title.children: Canberra students awake and in stable condition after being struck by allegedly stolen car

image.altText: Dutton protester

props.synopsis: Politicians say hecklers who gatecrashed Anthony Albanese's and Peter Dutton's campaign events will make it harder for them to interact with ordinary Australians.

title.children: Politicians urge 'ratbags' to stay away after hecklers gatecrash campaigns

image.altText: Two photographers take photo of Caz Heise and David Pocock

props.synopsis: Sitting federal independents have hit the hustings outside their own electorates, mentoring and campaigning for those who hope to follow in their footsteps to Canberra.

title.children: Independents 'pay it forward' in place of a party machine

image.altText: asio jfk

props.synopsis: Determined to hide Australia's secret version of the CIA from the public, ASIO kept a lid on its role in the JFK assassination probe.

title.children: The public didn't know Australia had its own deep state — ASIO kept it that way

image.altText: Graphic of someone falling into a phone head first.

props.synopsis: We may think smartphones are responsible for distracting us, but a new study suggests the devices aren't to blame, it's how we've been trained to use them.

title.children: Glued to TikTok? Ditching your smartphone may not break the habit

image.altText: Kren with her daughters Mikayla, brunette, and Alana, blonde.

props.synopsis: Karen Perks said her daughter was repeatedly misdiagnosed after she began suffering seizures. It took months of personal persistence before doctors found the real cause.

title.children: Repeatedly misdiagnosed teen lucky to find true cause with help from mum

image.altText: Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy hit the line in the 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout may have finished second to Lachlan Kennedy in a thrilling 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet in Melbourne, but the 17-year-old took valuable lessons away from the defeat.

title.children: 'Fuel to my fire': How Gout Gout will learn from loss to Australian rival

image.altText: Protesters holding banners in front of a building with Tesla logo

props.synopsis: The protesters are trying to escalate a movement targeting Tesla dealerships and vehicles to oppose Elon Musk's role as the head of the newly created Department of Government Efficiency, or DOGE.

title.children: Protesters against Musk's purge of US government swarm Tesla showrooms

image.altText: A woman in a blue button up uniform standing on a train platform.

props.synopsis: As the Queensland rail industry struggles to fill vacancies, train drivers like Nicole Sempf inspire more women to join.

title.children: Push to attract female train drivers to dispel 'blokey' industry myth

image.altText: A happy photo showing DJ Groove Terminator and the Soweto Gospel Choir cheering on a stage and smiling joyously at the camera.

props.synopsis: How an Australian DJ teamed up with the award-winning Soweto Gospel Choir for a project that celebrates the power of house music.

title.children: 'Dance music's my religion': How house brought a DJ and gospel choir together

image.altText: A woman smiles in a bush setting. She wears an Akubra hat and a backpack.

props.synopsis: Struggling after the death of her husband, Christina Sobey had her health checked and her blue station wagon serviced before travelling west to Australia's oldest and most remote bird research station.

title.children: 79yo bird-lover's solo pilgrimage across the country

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446971

props.synopsis: The leaders of Melbourne Victory's North Terrace supporter group boycotted the club's Pride Cup game against Adelaide United.

title.children: Melbourne Victory supporter group slammed over Pride Cup boycott

image.altText: A composite image of two missing brothers.

props.synopsis: Police are searching for two young brothers who were reported missing from Adelaide more than a fortnight ago, and are believed to be in the company of their father.

title.children: Search for young brothers reported missing 17 days ago

image.altText: Mansell2

props.synopsis: Richmond forward Rhyan Mansell could face three weeks on the sidelines in a landmark suspension that would set the tone for the AFL moving forward.

title.children: Tigers forward faces landmark suspension over push that left Saint concussed

image.altText: Jezzie in hospital with her family

props.synopsis: Jezabella shares her struggle of being diagnosed with a medical condition so rare, only eight other Australians were known to have it.

title.children: 'School years in a hospital bed': Growing up with a rare condition
